alert.note: Alert for Berrien (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 14 at 6:10PM EDT until June 14 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Berrien County in south central Georgia... * Until 700 PM EDT. * At 610 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Lenox, or 10 miles northwest of Nashville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Nashville and Alapaha around 625 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Weber, Glory, Berrien Co A/P and Bannockburn. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
